bibl.title: Furnishing Textiles in the Cairo Coptic Museum.
bibl.note: [Introduction.] - 1. Linen fabrics with scattered patterns. - 2. Linen hangings with large figures and pattern zones. - 3. Woven hanging. - 4. Spreads with brocaded patterns. - 5. Linen textiles with decoration in reserve technique. - 6. Painted cloth. - 7. Taqueté.

bibl.title: assisted by Susanne Martinssen-von Falck, Clothing the House. Furnishing Textiles of the 1st Millennium AD from Egypt and Neighbouring Countries. Proceedings of the 5th Conference of the Research Group 'Textiles from the Nile Valley', Antwerp, 6-7 October 2007.

bibl.seg: Nauerth Claudia, Furnishing Textiles in the Cairo Coptic Museum.

Antoine De Moor and Cäcilia Fluck (Edd.), assisted by Susanne Martinssen-von Falck, Clothing the House. Furnishing Textiles of the 1st Millennium AD from Egypt and Neighbouring Countries. Proceedings of the 5th Conference of the Research Group 'Textiles from the Nile Valley', Antwerp, 6-7 October 2007 (Tielt, 2009) pp. 100-114, 27 figg. coul.

[Introduction.] - 1. Linen fabrics with scattered patterns. - 2. Linen hangings with large figures and pattern zones. - 3. Woven hanging. - 4. Spreads with brocaded patterns. - 5. Linen textiles with decoration in reserve technique. - 6. Painted cloth. - 7. Taqueté.
